document_data.name: Annelwin Toralynnsyr
document_data.mainbody: '''Annelwin Toralynnsyr''' was a [[half-elf]] [[ranger]] of the [[Elmanesse]] tribe in the [[Forest of Tethir]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite card/AD&D Trading Cards/1992|103|Annelwin}}The AD&D Trading Card "Annelwin" places her in the unknown "Tethyr Wood", but ''Lands of Intrigue: Tethyr'' corrects this to the [[Forest of Tethir]].
document_data.Description: Annelwin dressed in green-colored clothing and had long brown hair and light skin.
document_data.Relationships: She was married to fellow elven ranger [[Katyr Toralynnsyr|Katyr]],{{Cite card/AD&D Trading Cards/1992|102|Katyr}} who was a scout for the tribe.
document_data.Personality:
Annelwin was serious-minded in all matters, but particularly the care of forest creatures.

Although he was entirely [[mute]], Katyr was able to communicate with his wife using a simple [[sign language]], which she in turn translated for others. Katyr was one of the few people able to pierce his wife's serious demeanor to make her smile and laugh, but only occasionally and never whilst working.
document_data.Possessions: She owned a magical ''[[tunic of blending]]''.
document_data.Activities: Katyr and Annelwin kept a vigil over the forests of northern [[Tethyr]], keeping merchants safe and treating injured animals. She punished severely any reckless hunters and [[adventurer]]s she found. They also thwarted poachers and others up to no good on the [[Trade Way]] north of [[Mosstone]] by [[1370 DR]].
document_data.History: Annelwin hailed from [[Brost]], but became a full member of the Elmanesse elf tribe.
